channel.title: fuzzing on BananaMafia
channel.description: Recent content in fuzzing on BananaMafia

item.title: Fuzzing A GameBoy Emulator With AFL++
item.description: Recently I’ve started a little fuzzing project. After doing some research, I’ve decided to fuzz a gaming emulator. The target of choice is a GameBoy and GameBoy Advance emulator called VisualBoyAdvance-M, which is also called VBA-M. At the time of writing the emulator was still being maintained. VBA-M seems to be a fork of VisualBoyAdvance, for which development seems to have stopped in 2006. Disclaimer: I’m publishing this blog post to share some fuzzing methodology and tooling and not to blame the developers.

item.title: In-Process Fuzzing With Frida
item.description: In a previous post I’ve already covered Frida and its instrumentation abilities. But check this out: You can also use Frida to perform fuzzing. What’s even greater is that Frida allows in-process fuzzing. Why would you want to do this? There may be various reasons, but the most outstanding one for me is building a fuzzing harness for closed source applications and libraries. Just take Counter Strike GO as an example:
